intro: Mulfordia boliviana, commonly known as the Bolivian mulfordia, is a flowering plant native to the Andean regions of Bolivia. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton plants. The plant is characterized by its showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that typically bloom in shades of pink and white. It thrives in high-altitude environments with well-drained soil and full sun exposure. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
